From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

German

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Süsswasser (Switzerland, Liechtenstein)

Etymology

[edit]

From süß (“sweet”) +‎ Wasser (“water”). For examples of the typology (fresh water being “sweet”), see English sweet water.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈzyːsvasɐ/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: Süß‧was‧ser

Noun

[edit]

Süßwasser n (strong, genitive Süßwassers, no plural)

  1. fresh water (not salted)
    Antonym: Salzwasser

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Süßwasser [sg-only, neuter, strong]
singular
indef. def. noun
nominative ein das Süßwasser
genitive eines des Süßwassers
dative einem dem Süßwasser
accusative ein das Süßwasser

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Süßwasserbecken
  • Süßwasserfisch
  • Süßwasserkrabbe

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Süßwasser” in Duden online
  • “Süßwasser” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
